description.narrative:
PLEASE REVIEW YOUR ANSWER AS THE QUESTION HAS BEEN CHANGED
Sveriges Ambassad i Maputo (EoS) avser att bidra med 4 000 000 SEK till genomförandet av utlysningen "Call for Proposals: Climate Change Resilience and Adaptation Mozambique" under 2015- 2106. Insatsen förväntas resultera i 3-4 studier.
Syftet med att lansera en Call for Proposal är att stimulera samarbete, kunskaps- och informationsutbyte mellan olika aktörer i Moçambique inom området klimatförändringar och resiliens, samt att locka fram nya idéer och sprida dem bland relevanta intressenter i landet. Fokus för utlysningen är kritiska hinder- och möjliga lösningar till ökad resiliens och förbättrad anpassning till klimatförändringar och naturkatastrofer.
Av insatsen på 4 000 000 SEK, har 3 186 302 SEK budgeterats för att täcka bidrag till 3-4 forskningsstudier, på 800 000 - 1 000 000 SEK/studie. Resterande 296 296 SEK täcker UNDPs kostnader för att driva projektet, inklusive lön till en projektledare och kostnader i samband med att sprida resultaten, t.ex. för att producera trycksaker och att organisera seminarium.

The Embassy of Sweden in Maputo (EoS) will fund UNDP with 4 000 000 SEK to carry out the "Call for Proposals: Climate Change Resilience and Adaptation Mozambique" during 2015-2016. This intervention concerns the preparation and evaluation phase of the competition. It is intended to result in 3-5 action oriented research studies.
The aim of launching a Call for Proposals is to stimulate collaboration, learning and information sharing between actors in Mozambique in the field of climate change resilience and adaptation, as well as to generate and publicly disseminate knowledge and surface ideas among key stakeholders in Mozambique about critical barriers and potential solutions to building resilience and adapting to climate change and natural disasters.

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Three comprehensive study reports were produced as a result of SIDA funding, these comprises: i) Mitigation Strategy to the Impact of Climate Change due to Deforestation of Mopane Forest for Production of Domestic Energy from Wood, ii) Analyses on efficacy and gaps in the current climate adaptation knowledge system in Agricultural Sector in Mozambique, and iii)Assessing the effectiveness, impact and sustainability of local initiatives to improve climate change resilience. UNDP engaged the Academy of Science of Mozambique to get their support in launching and dissemination of the studies. As part of this engagement, the President of the Academy of Science of Mozambique wrote and signed the Forewords for the studies, which are part of the final version of the report.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
